page.title: 07Our Village In The Past.
page.content: We have been studying maps of Esh Winning and have discovered the following important dates.The railway was opened in 1857 and closed in 1963. Esh Winning shaft was sunk in 1859 and the colliery closed in 1968.The Stag's Head (1868),Durham Road School (1892),3 rows of houses around the pit (1896),Post Office(i1896),Co-op(1914), and the road from Esh Winning to Waterhouses(1920) indicate how our village has grown.In1871 there were only 25 houses and some families were living in huts. The most amazing fact about the 1856 map is that Esh Winning does not exist.N.E.Railway(Deerness Valley Branch),Waterhouses Colliery,a house at Low Waterhouse,2 houses at Newhouse, Flass Hall and the Roman Road (Watling Street) are all that is to be found on the 1856 map.
